Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.name: successfulResponse(statusCode:data:request:response:)
Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.abstract: The Moya network request was successful (HTTP request successful with status code >= 200 and < 300). You may not need to do anything here, but it is here in case you want to run some code after a successful API request.

Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.name: statusCodeError(statusCode:data:request:response:)
Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.abstract: Moya network request was successful, but a HTTP status code was returned >= 300.

Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.name: networkingError(error:request:response:)
Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.abstract: Moya network request was not successful. No network connection, bad network connection, permission error, SSL error, etc.

Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.name: moyaError(error:)
Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.abstract: Moya error encountered. This is a Moya specific error. It could be because Moya had an error parsing the response body to JSON/Image/String. It could be an invalid status code. This is probably an error that you should fix in your app’s code. It may not be a user issue.

Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.name: unknownError(error:)
Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html#/s:FP.abstract: Error that is not a URLError or Moya error. It is an unknown error that you should handle yourself. Not sure why this would ever happen in your code, but something happened.

Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html.name: MoyaResponseHandler
Protocols/MoyaResponseHandler.html.abstract: Protocol used to handle the Moya network request from the MoyaResponseHandlerPlugin.

Enums/MoyaResponseError.html#/s:FO25Moya.name: networkingError
Enums/MoyaResponseError.html#/s:FO25Moya.abstract: The user encountered a networking issue with their API request.

Enums/MoyaResponseError.html#/s:FO25Moya.name: statusCodeError
Enums/MoyaResponseError.html#/s:FO25Moya.abstract: The request was successful, but the status code is >= 300.

Enums/MoyaResponseError.html#/s:FO25Moya.name: moyaError
Enums/MoyaResponseError.html#/s:FO25Moya.abstract: Moya specific error. Moya had an error mapping response body to JSON, Image, String, etc.

Enums/MoyaResponseError.html#/s:FO25Moya.name: otherError
Enums/MoyaResponseError.html#/s:FO25Moya.abstract: Not any of the URLError or Moya error types. Unknown error to the plugin.

Enums/MoyaNetworkingError.html#/s:FO25Mo.name: badNetworkRequest
Enums/MoyaNetworkingError.html#/s:FO25Mo.abstract: Network request failed from some error that could be from a bad network connection.

Enums/MoyaNetworkingError.html#/s:FO25Mo.name: failedNetworkRequest
Enums/MoyaNetworkingError.html#/s:FO25Mo.abstract: All other URLError types. In most cases, these errors are a result of a developer error. A user should not encounter these errors such as having SSL cert issues, permission issues, file issues, etc.

Enums/MoyaNetworkingError.html.name: MoyaNetworkingError
Enums/MoyaNetworkingError.html.abstract: Moya encountered a networking error with the request. These errors are all URLError types.

Enums/MoyaResponseError.html.name: MoyaResponseError
Enums/MoyaResponseError.html.abstract: The error type that we return to the Moya Target’s error handler in your app code.

Classes/MoyaResponseHandlerPlugin.html#/.name: init(handler:)
Classes/MoyaResponseHandlerPlugin.html#/.abstract: Provide the MoyaResponseHandlerPlugin with your code to be executed after each Moya network request.

Classes/MoyaResponseHandlerPlugin.html.name: MoyaResponseHandlerPlugin
Classes/MoyaResponseHandlerPlugin.html.abstract: Moya plugin that handles Moya responses before completion handler is called. The plugin will take the response, see if it was successful or failed and allow developer to quickly and easily handle the response in a nice API.
